text: You never cease to amaze me with your video game taste! It feels like you have something from every video game series out there, no matter how small it is! Oh, by the way. I found out about this game yesterday. It seems like an extremely underrated hidden gem so I bought it today. I am looking forward to play it after I finish Twilight Princess HD. :)
author: YolmzWelra

text: Loved this games music, but man... the level layouts. I've never got so lost in towns before!
author: USER NAME

text: Never did give this game a try.
author: KSib

text:
Same tune as Blue Desert and Holy Wilds... I wonder which came first.

The soundtrack is still golden even though melodies were reused.
author: Sephiko

text: After all these Opoona uploads, I probably don't need to reiterate how much I love this soundtrack (and the game!). I remember when there were rumors that Opoona was coming to the 3DS, unfortunately they never materialized. At this point, even an Opoona trophy in Smash would please me.
author: SupraDarky

text: What makes you love it so much?
author: pseudogenesis

text: It would surprise me too, considering Nintendo had nothing to do with Opoona's development.
author: Medal Melodies

text: @pseudogenesis I know what makes me love it so much, it's how it sucks you into the world so well, the most I've ever felt a part of a game ever, the music and the world are just so charming and you kind of wish you lived in this weird bureaucratic sci-fi world. Also there's just loads to do and explore, totally what I'm into.
author: matt036

text: Supra, it's really terrible that you're the only person I know (and even then I don't know you) who has even played this game. It's honestly so great and I love when you upload a song from it, the soundtrack is perfect! a little trophy of opoona would be amazing, or just any recognition for it at all. I'd definitely say that Opoona could sit in the MoMA Video Game Collection
author: matt036
